intro: Eumorpha, commonly known as the swallowtail butterfly, is a genus of butterflies in the family Papilionidae. These insects are characterized by their striking wing patterns, which often feature bright colors and intricate designs. Eumorpha species are primarily found in the Americas, ranging from the southern United States to South America. Their larvae, known as caterpillars, feed on plants in the parsley family, such as dill and fennel. The genus includes several species, each with unique variations in coloration and wing morphology.
